root: ^Miles and miles of newly built road, interrupted only by a few brief stops at maintenance stations.
^The trip was finally over. The prisoners and convoy officers had reached The North East Labour Camp.
^As the gates closed, guards moved into the main yard and formed a semi-circle.
^White overcoats, red faces. They held their guns loosely, eyes showing no interest.
^It was just another routine procedure in the North; This was the final batch of convicts. The year was nearly over.
^Prisoners! You have arrived at the North East Labour Camp! This is where you are going to live and work.
^You are criminals. Thieves. Murderers. Political enemies of the people! Your counterrevolutionary activity and sabotage cannot be forgiven!
^But the Soviet Government is wise and humane. It gives you a second chance.
^Work for the sake of the Soviet state and the Soviet people! Show your enthusiasm, join the proletariat, and do your time with honor!
^Do not forget what Comrade Stalin once said: Labor in the USSR is a matter of honor, glory, courage, and heroism!
^Only through hardship and labor will you find your way to join Soviet society and step into the bright Socialist future!
^Alright, we are done here. Go to your assigned barracks and await further orders!
